availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eli P. Metcalfe (Cincinnati, Ohio, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Fannie C. Metcalfe. Father of Rhodale Metcalfe, Fannie Metcalfe, Even Metcalfe, and Allen Metcalfe. Farmer in Hamilton County in 1860. Served as a private and corporal in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) from August 11, 1862, to September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Millcreek Township, p. 821.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, 22nd Ward, p. 718B
Organization Index to Pension Files of Veterans Who Served Between 1861 and 1900, compiled 1949-1949, documenting the period 1861-1942, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T289, Roll pub57synthroll435.
_Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 258.
Card Records of Headstones Provided for Deceased Union Civil War Veterans, ca. 1879-ca. 1903 (National Archives Microfilm Publication M1845, 22 rolls); Records of the Office of the Quartermaster General, Record Group 92; National Archives, Washington, D.C., p. 1124
